sn10.6:4.1: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn10.6:4.2: Now at that time Venerable Anuruddha rose before dawn and recited passages of the teaching.
sn10.6:4.3: Then the native spirit Piyaṅkara’s Mother soothed her little child, saying:
sn10.6:5.2: A mendicant recites passages of the teaching.
sn10.6:5.4: we can practice for our welfare.
sn10.6:6.1: Let us keep from harming living creatures,
sn10.6:6.3: We should train ourselves well in ethics,
sn10.6:6.4: and hopefully we’ll be freed from the goblin realm.”
